document_title: Ventricular tachycardia: Causes, symptoms, diagnosis, prevention
subsection_content:
A healthy lifestyle will help reduce the risk of many cardiovascular diseases. MSc.BS.CKI Vu Xuan Quang believes that you can protect yourself from coronary artery disease (the most common cause of ventricular tachycardia) in the following ways:
Practice a low-fat, high-fiber diet;; Exercise regularly;; Control weight, avoid overweight and obesity;; Quit smoking, avoid inhaling passive smoke, do not use electronic cigarettes...; Comply with your doctor's treatment if you have diseases such as hypertension, diabetes, dyslipidemia, etc.
